_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:58:38 using v2.0
title: Why are patients exiting alcohol treatment and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: Alcohol consumption is a contributing factor to hospital admissions and deaths from a diverse range of conditions. There were over one million hospital admissions related to alcohol in 2009/10, so reducing alcohol abuse through successful treatment can help reduce this. The proportion of service users who had completed alcohol treatment successfully was 57% in 2011/12, this is a nine per cent increase from 48% in 2009/10.
